episodes.title: Why Some Iglesia Ni Cristo Members Disown Family Members
episodes.description:
In this video, I discuss the common phenomenon of banishing and abandoning family members who leave the Iglesia Ni Cristo. Keep in mind this is super COMMON in a lot of religious cults as well as within mainstream Christianity but within a narcissistic system the repercussions can lead to anger, rage, violence, and harm.

What's my story?
My name is Elaine, mental health advocate/educator. I am currently in school to obtain my associate clinical counseling degree. I hold a Master's Degree in Education with a concentration in counseling  from San Diego State University and my thesis was on: Unraveling the Narratives of Filipinas Who Have Experienced Intimate Partner Violence or Domestic Violence

My theoretical orientation is mixed and *I draw heavily upon feminist, experiential, narrative, mindfulness and acceptance & commitment, psychodynamic and cognitive-behavioral therapy approaches*.
Style: Compassion focused, humanistic, strengths-based, collaborative

 Feel free to leave a question or comment down below! Email: memoirelaine90@gmail.com
Would you like to work or collaborate with me? Please email me at memorelaine90@gmail.com for requests.

episodes.title: Domestic Violence Awareness Month: Ali and Ana Abulaban: A Closer look
episodes.description:
Hi everyone! This video is a little different from what I usually post, but in in honor of Filipino-American history month and Domestic Violence Awareness month, I take a closer look at the tragic case of Ali Abulaban and Ana Abulaban. This is a sensitive subject and I hope I can shed some light on this case in hopes of preventing others from going through similar situations. I also touch base on how I would treat Ali Abulaban if I was his therapist. 

What's my story?
My name is Elaine, mental health advocate/educator. I am currently in school to obtain my associate clinical counseling degree. I hold a Master's Degree in Education with a concentration in counseling  from San Diego State University and my thesis was on: Unraveling the Narratives of Filipinas Who Have Experienced Intimate Partner Violence or Domestic Violence

My theoretical orientation and style is mixed and *I draw heavily upon humanistic, feminist, narrative, mindfulness and acceptance & commitment, psychodynamic and cognitive-behavioral therapy approaches*. Feel free to leave a question or comment down below! Email: memoirelaine90@gmail.com

If you or someone you know is experiencing domestic family violence, please view the resources below:

Crisis Text Line (24/7): 
Text HOME to 741741 

National Domestic Violence Hotline
Hours: 24/7. Languages: English, Spanish and 200+ through interpretation service Learn more
800-799-7233
SMS: Text START to 88788

*Psychoeducation*: It's My life Now: Starting Over After an Abusive Relationship or Domestic Violence by Meg Kennedy Dugan and Roger R. Hock

Resources: https://licensetofreedom.org
*(For those seeking therapy and Domestic violence resources in San Diego)*

You deserve a REAL love filled with respect, mutuality, and reciprocity. Let's end Domestic Family violence together.

With love,
Elaine, M.A.

episodes.title: The INC and the 5 Most Common Mind Traps
episodes.description:
In this video, I discuss the 5 most common Mind traps or Cognitive Distortions that can develop as a result of growing up or being raised in a high control religion, fundamentalist system or religious cult. *Please keep in mind this video is meant to be educational and these mind traps will vary from person to person. Not everyone will have the exact same experience, but it's important to acknowledge that this CAN happen.*

episodes.title: Setting Boundaries After Leaving a High Control Religion or Religious Cult
episodes.description:
Healing Technique: Setting Personal Boundaries

The likelihood of being taught how to set a personal boundary is slim to none when you grow up in a high control religion or religious cult. Often members are taught to adhere to strict and rigid boundaries, often to excess. After leaving a high control religion, it can be difficult to practice setting personal boundaries because it’s foreign and your body isn’t use to it. Please know this can be undone, and you can regain your autonomy again, you can regain your voice again. Deconstruct with me.

*What's my story?*
My name is Elaine, mental health advocate/educator. I am currently in school to obtain my associate clinical counseling degree. I hold a Master's Degree in Education with a concentration in counseling  from San Diego State University and my thesis was on: Unraveling the Narratives of Filipinas Who Have Experienced Intimate Partner Violence or Domestic Violence

episodes.title: The Brain of a Religious Cult member: Amygdala Hijacking
episodes.description: In this video, I touch on a bit of neuroscience to help explain what happens inside the brain of a cult member and how certain behavior can manifest and may result in hyper vigilance, ptsd symptoms and hyper arousal in some cases. Please note, this video is meant to be educational and symptoms may present differently for everyone. I hope this video can provide more context, especially when encountering family members who are deeply entrenched in the doctrines. Thank you for watching and take good care! -Elaine

episodes.title: Growing Up As a Child In The Iglesia Ni Cristo: Impact on Brain Development and Protective Factors
episodes.description:
Hi everyone! :)

Memoir_Elaine again, certified mental health recovery and trauma informed advocate, educator and counselor. I am also in the process of obtaining religious trauma certification. 
In this video, I discuss the negative or cognitive impacts that a child can experience as a result of growing up in a high control, cult religion. This video was created with the intention of shedding light on how harmful religious practices and indoctrination can impact a child and how it can affect them emotionally, psychologically, and mentally. 
I also highlight protective factors that can minimize the harm that often accompanies high control, fundamentalist and authoritarian religions like the Iglesia Ni Cristo or INC.

Warmly,
Elaine
Credentials: 
+MA in Education with a Concentration in Counseling
(Capstone/Thesis: Unraveling the Narratives of Filipinas Who Have Experienced Intimate Partner Violence)

episodes.title: The Parallels Between an Abusive Relationship and a High Control/Cult Religion
episodes.description:
Hi everyone! 

Elaine again, Mental health and religious trauma advocate. In this mental health video, I discuss the parallels and similarities between a high control religion/cult and an abusive/domestic violence relationship. If this video resonates with you or if you have noticed any other parallels that I didn’t mention, definitely feel free to leave a comment below. Thank you for watching! 

Credentials: 
+MA in Education with a Concentration in Counseling
(Capstone/Thesis: Unraveling the Narratives of Filipinas Who Have Experienced Intimate Partner Violence)
+Certified in Mental Health Recovery & Trauma-Informed Care 
+BA in Child Development
+Religious trauma certification (In Progress)

If you or someone you know is experiencing domestic violence or being faced with threats and are being harassed or are experiencing a mental health crisis please reach out to your local emergency services or the hotlines below:

Crisis Text Line (24/7): 
Text HOME to 741741 

National Domestic Violence Hotline
Hours: 24/7. Languages: English, Spanish and 200+ through interpretation service Learn more
800-799-7233
SMS: Text START to 88788

Psychoeducation/Books: When Religion Hurts you by Dr. Laura Anderson
https://www.amazon.com
/When-Religion-Hurts-You-High-Control/dp/1587435888

episodes.title: Leaving the INC/Iglesia ni Cristo Part 2: Religious Abuse/Religious Trauma & My story
episodes.description:
Hi there! :) 

*Disclaimer* This video was created with the intent to serve as an educational tool and space for religious trauma survivors and those that are currently experiencing religious abuse & trauma as a result of controlling, manipulative and coercive practices and behavior. I also want to state that I am not anti-religion. I believe religion can be a beautiful, healing platform for many but I also recognize the existence of power and control dynamics in certain religious institutions & cults that can cause psychological harm.*

Memoir_Elaine again, certified mental health recovery and trauma informed advocate, educator and counselor. I am also in the process of obtaining religious trauma certification. In this video I circle back on the very first video I made regarding leaving the INC or the Iglesia ni Cristo. 
I speak from a trauma-informed lens as well as highlight how harmful, unhealthy, and coercive practices that exist within high control religions and cults like the INC can impact someone's mental health and the damaging effects it can have on someone's self esteem, nervous system and well- being.
 If this video resonates with you or if you can take away something from it, I hope it can bring you some clarity or perhaps it can provide you with something new you have never thought of before.

Warmly,
Elaine
Credentials: 
+MA in Education with a Concentration in Counseling
(Capstone/Thesis: Unraveling the Narratives of Filipinas Who Have Experienced Intimate Partner Violence)
+Certified in Mental Health Recovery & Trauma-Informed Care 
+BA in Child Development
+Religious trauma certification (In Progress)

*If you or someone you know is experiencing domestic violence or being faced with threats and are being harassed or are experiencing a mental health crisis please reach out to your local emergency services or the hotlines below:*

Crisis Text Line (24/7): 
Text HOME to 741741 

National Domestic Violence Hotline
Hours: 24/7. Languages: English, Spanish and 200+ through interpretation service Learn more
800-799-7233
SMS: Text START to 88788

Books: When Religion Hurts you by Dr. Laura Anderson
https://www.amazon.com
/When-Religion-Hurts-You-High-Control/dp/1587435888

episodes.title: Trauma and People Pleasing
episodes.description:
A short video I made for Instagram on the impact of people pleasing as a trauma response as the result of growing up in a shame inducing or guilt inducing environment. 

I highlight the effects of growing up in a fundamentalist Christian or cult environment such as the iglesia in cristo or more widely known as the INC. But this can also be applied to other environments, cults, and other relational systems as well, such as a domestic violence relationship or a narcissistic relationship.

Do you struggle with people pleasing? Please feel free to leave a comment below if this resonates with with you or if can relate to this. 

Warmly,
Memoir_elaine
IG: Memoir_Elaine

episodes.title: Leaving the Iglesia ni Cristo or the INC: Impact, Implications, Aftermath, Healing, & Resources.
episodes.description:
Hi! My name is Elaine Quiambao, Mental health advocate/counselor.
I have a background in Mental health recovery and Trauma Informed Care and hold a B.A in Child Development and a Master's degree in Education with a concentration in Counseling from San Diego State University. I am also in the process of obtaining Religious Trauma certification.

In this video I discuss the impact of leaving an Authoritarian or Fundamentalist religion and the transition of leaving. I acknowledge how painful it can be when transitioning out of a religion or faith you were raised in. I also acknowledge how painful it can be for families experiencing this. This video is not meant to criticize or point blame or create shame, it is meant to educate and create space for healing and awareness regarding a very sensitive topic that many communities experience, especially collectivist or tight-knit communities. I hope it can bring you a sense of peace and if you can relate or if it resonates with you, feel free to leave a comment. I wish you the best on your healing journey.

"What may be a source of strength for you can be a thorn for someone else"- Elaine, M.A.

With love & support,
Elaine (instagram.com/memoir_elaine)

National Domestic Violence hotline:
https://www.thehotline.org

*Free online Resources for healing during your transition:
www.traumastery.com/religious-trauma-quiz
https://www.tothinkagain.co.uk
/identifying-a-cult
https://www.tothinkagain.co.uk
/communicating-with-a-cult-member
www.spiritualsoundingboard.com/2020/05/25/religious-power-and-control-minimizing-denying-and-blaming/
https://www.religioustraumainstitute.com
www.therapinay.com
www.choosingtherapy.com/religious-trauma-syndrome/
www.betterhelp.com
https://up2sd.org/
www.webmd.com
/balance/features/how-to-be-more-empathetic

*Religious trauma certification for counselors/therapists/healers:
https://www.traumastery.com

*Psychoeducation/Books: 
Adult Children of Emotionally Immature Parents: How to Heal from Distant, Rejecting, or Self-Involved Parents by Lindsay C. Gibson.

*SDSU MA degree in Education with a concentration in counseling: 
https://education2.sdsu.edu/csp
/programs-of-study/hybrid-ma-counseling

*** Absolutely NO shaming, spiteful or hateful comments will be tolerated*** Thank you!
